result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin D Mentch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine to be paid in 60 days or penalty of 6 days jail for non-payment.

15TR6469 was dismissed and read in.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Austin D Mentch

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Austin D Mentch in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court orders the following:  $330.50 to be paid within 60 days or 6 days jail for penalty for non payment of fine.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Austin D Mentch in court with Attorney Daniel P Fay.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Fay requests an adjournment so Defendant can obtain counseling and accept state's offer.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
(Fax) Dated today, from Atty Fay to Judge Carter, advising that the case is resolved and Defendant will be seeking assesment before entering plea.
Updated witness list. Filed by the DA.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Defendant Austin D Mentch in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.  Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Fay requests a jury trial date on 15CM2217, other case to follow. Court sets.   Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Austin D Mentch in court.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he did see the public defender yet.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Court orders Defendant to see the public defender and be evaluated.  Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Austin D Mentch in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.
